title: Email sender icons
content:
eMClient generates nice, colorful, easily identified icons in the email list. For example, an email from Redfin is a bright, big, red R. From Bark, a blue dog. From Zillow, the Zillow symbol.

This is a great feature when visually searching the Inbox.

Is there a means to have Thunderbird do this?
creator: ThurstonOR

title: I see my exact problem in a supposedly fixed bug report, but it has not been fixed for me
content:
Whenever I reopen Thunderbird 140esr (it has this behavior on 140.0, 140.1.0 and now 140.2.0), there is a second lower case "thunderbird" process that causes 50-150% CPU usage in the two processes. Also if I quit with both processes active I get an error message that "thunderbird" has unexpectedly quit. If I quit the "thunderbird" process with Activity Monitor the CPU issues go away for as long as the Thunderbird app is open.

I found this exact issue as a reported bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1977514&_gl=1*1coyjyr*_ga*ODYxNzE0NjQyLjE2OTY0NDU3MDg.*_ga_2VC139B3XV*czE3NTY2OTAwOTckbzMkZzEkdDE3NTY2OTAyMzYkajI0JGwwJGgw It says that it was fixed, though, and it has not been for me. Does that mean it's only been fixed in versions not yet released, or is it already (incorrectly) believed to be fixed for everyone? Thank you.
creator: jenniferehle1

title: Selecing Get Messages hangs on Checking mail server capabilites
content:
My Thunderbird program stopped receiving email messages 8/21/2025 and when selecting Get Messages, it hangs up on Checking Mail Server Capabilities and that's as far as it goes and no new messages are received.

My ISP's website IS receiving my email messages and I can read them there but I prefer reading and replying on Thunderbird instead of their website.

One solution on the forum suggested disabling STARTTLS. When I put that in the search bar in Settings it says it's sorry but it didn't find anything like that.

title: non riesco a leggere le mail archiviate sul Qnap.
content: non riesco a leggere le mail archiviate sul Qnap. Utilizzo Thunderbird da molti anni e non avevo mai avuto questo problema. Da alcuni mesi quando archivio le mail sul Qnap e poi voglio leggerle si apre la finestra ma resta bianca senza nessuna informazione. Per rileggere la mail la devo copiare sul desktop del pc e le leggo. Il problema è solo con il pc fisso che utilizzo che opera in W10, con il portatile tutto funziona che opera in W11.

creator: Bonnie2

title: outbound emails landing in recipients spam folders
content: Our emails have been set up to download from the host server to a gmail account (to reduce storage requirement on host as Gmail is 15gb free) when we reply it sends via our host server to keep the preferred email address (don't want business emails going out with gmail.com address). However we are now finding out that 95% of our emails are landing in spam folders/promo folders or bouncing back. Our host thinks this is caused by using Thunderbird (adding another layer of diversion) even though it was his suggestion that we use Thunderbird in the first place. I like the package as it allows me to see multiple email addresses all in the one package and I don't have any issues with the other email accounts, and I don't have to have multiple tabs open in chrome to view emails. I know you're probably going to say that it's the inclusion of the additional Gmail account that is causing this issue, I just need confirmation to take to him Thanks in advance for your assistance.
creator: om30

title: Downloading all emails ... again
content:
Hi,

Last weekend I installed Thunderbird v128.14.0esr (64-bit) onto my (fully updated) Debian Bookworm laptop. I then set Thunderbird to synchronise with my Gmail account. This resulted in Thunderbird downloading all 96,970 emails then in my Gmail account onto my hdd using IMAP. This was just what I wanted.

This morning, when using Thunderbird, it once again started to download all(!!) the emails in my Gmail account. [This now stands at 102,205 messages, though I really[!!] doubt that I received 5,235 messages over the weekend. :) ] With my relatively slow download bandwidth bouncing around the 50 KiBs/s mark, this will take hours.

What I'd like to know is that, once this large download is complete, how do I then set Thunderbird so that it will download only(!!) new messages from that point onward ?

Stuart
creator: stuarte83

title: Retrieve old emails after changing email address
content: I changed my email address and I can no longer use it to read or send emails. When I open Thunderbird, it asks me for a password which doesn't work. I would like to see the emails that have been downloaded. I was using IMAP. How do I do this?

title: Trasferimento email da un PC ad un altro
content:
Se traferisco il profilo da un PC ad un altro, vengono copiati anche gli errori presenti nel profilo: errori non identificati che non mi permettono di modificare le preferenze di TB e non mi fanno ricevere messaggi se con con ore di attesa.

In sostanza vorrei trasferire tutte le email così come appaiono nel mio vecchio TB (suddivise per cartelle e con le date originali) ad un nuovo PC, ma escludendo gli errori del profilo.

Qualcuno può aiutarmi? Grazie, Marco
creator: cronosdata
